t: Psalm 31
A Plea for Protection
For the choir director. A psalm of David.
Lord,*spn I seek refuge in you; let*ln me never be disgraced. Save*ln me by your righteousness.
Listen*ln closely to me; rescue me quickly. Be*ln a rock of refuge for me, a*ln mountain fortress to save me.
For*ln you are my rock and my fortress; you*ln lead and guide me for*ln your name’s sake.
You*ln will free me from the net that*ln is secretly set for me, for*ln you are my refuge.
Into*ln your hand I entrust my spirit; you*ln have redeemed me, Lord,*s God of truth.
I*pn hate those who are devoted to worthless idols, but*ln I trust in the Lord.*s
I*ln will rejoice and be glad in your faithful love because*ln you have seen my affliction. You*ln know the troubles of my soul
and*ln have not handed me over to the enemy. You*ln have set my feet in a spacious place.
Be*pn gracious to me, Lord,*s because*ln I am in distress; my*ln eyes are worn out from frustration — my*ln whole being as well.
Indeed,*ln my life is consumed with grief and*ln my years with groaning; my*ln strength has failed because*ln of my iniquity, and*ln my bones waste away.
I*ln am ridiculed by all my adversaries and*ln even by my neighbors. I*ln am dreaded by my acquaintances; those*ln who see me in the street run from me.
I*ln am forgotten: gone from memory like*ln a dead person — like broken pottery.
I*ln have heard the gossip of many; terror*ln is on every side. When*ln they conspired against me, they*ln plotted to take my life.
But*pn I trust in you, Lord;*s I*ln say, “You are my God.”
The*ln course of my life is in your power; rescue*ln me from the power of my enemies and*ln from my persecutors.
Make*ln your face shine on your servant; save*ln me by your faithful love.
Lord,*sln do not let me be disgraced when I call on you. Let*ln the wicked be disgraced; let*ln them be quiet in Sheol.
Let*ln lying lips that*ln arrogantly speak against the righteous in*ln proud contempt be silenced.
How*pn great is your goodness, which*ln you have stored up for those who fear you. In*ln the presence of everyone you have acted for*ln those who take refuge in you.
You*ln hide them in the protection of your presence; you*ln conceal them in a shelter from*ln human schemes, from*ln quarrelsome tongues.
Blessed*ln be the Lord,*s for*ln he has wondrously shown his faithful love to me in*ln a city under siege.
In*ln my alarm I said, “I*ln am cut off from your sight.” But*ln you heard the sound of my pleading when*ln I cried to you for help.
Love*pn the Lord,*s all his faithful ones. The*ln Lord*s protects the loyal, but*ln fully repays the arrogant.
Be*ln strong, and let your heart be courageous, all*ln you who put your hope in the Lord.*s
